content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

entries.title: These $140 earbuds translate 50+ languages while you listen
entries.snippet: The Mymanu Orb Open-Ear AI Translation Earbuds, showcased at CES 2026, offer users a unique blend of audio entertainment, real-world awareness, and advanced language translation technology. Priced at $139.99 (down from a $179.99 MSRP), these earbuds feature an open-ear design that allows users to hear their surroundings while simultaneously listening to music, taking calls, or translating real-time conversations. The standout feature is their built-in AI, which supports translation in over 50 languages across live conversations, phone calls, and spoken audio—ideal for travel, work, or multilingual environments. Beyond translation, the earbuds function as typical audio accessories with a sleek, lightweight, and water-resistant design. With up to 35 hours of battery life using the charging case and hands-free controls, they offer a user-friendly and futuristic audio solution without added complexity.

entries.title: Real-time speech-to-speech translation - Google Research
entries.snippet: Cascaded S2ST Prior real-time speech-to-speech technologies employed a cascaded pipeline of individual processing blocks: Firstly, the source audio is transcribed to text using automatic speech recognition (ASR) AI models. Next, the transcribed text is translated word-for-word to the target language using automatic speech translation (AST).

entries.title: Google Translate brings real-time speech translations to any headphones
entries.snippet:
Google Translate has introduced a major update allowing live speech translations on all headphones, not just Google's Pixel Buds. Available in beta starting today, the feature supports over 70 languages and requires only a compatible Android phone with the Translate app—unlike Apple’s version, which is limited to AirPods. This expansion marks a shift towards broader accessibility for real-time translation.

Additionally, Google Translate is improving text translations with the help of its Gemini AI, which enhances the accuracy of idioms and slang, offering more natural interpretations of phrases like “stealing my thunder.” The update also expands the Practice feature—similar to Duolingo—to 20 more countries and supports more languages. This interactive learning tool provides personalized sessions that adapt to users’ language levels.

The live translation update is rolling out on Android in the US, Mexico, and India, with an iOS version expected next year. Enhanced text translations are also now available on both Android and iOS, as well as the web. The Practice feature remains in beta and may be limited to some users.

entries.title: Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: MuAViC: A Multilingual Audio-Visual Corpus for Robust Speech Recognition and Robust Speech-to-Text Translation
All Windows Users Can Now Translate Speech in Real Time
entries.snippet:
Microsoft has announced that its real-time speech translation technology is now available to all Skype users on Windows. This tool allows users to translate conversations almost instantly in seven supported languages: English, Chinese Mandarin, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish. Text-to-text translation is also available in over 50 languages. The rollout comes after a gradual introduction that began in October and follows initial demonstrations in 2014. Users can activate the translator by clicking the globe icon in Skype, provided their app is up to date.

Since its launch, Skype Translator has seen significant growth, with call volume increasing by 400%. The most popular language pair to date has been French-to-English. Microsoft's translation services improve continuously through machine learning, which enables the software to enhance its performance over time based on past interactions, allowing more accurate and natural translations.

v.title: RealTranS: End-to-End Simultaneous Speech Translation with Convolutional Weighted-Shrinking Transformer

entries.title: Apple announces bringing Live Translation to Messages, FaceTime and Phone calls at WWDC 2025
entries.snippet: At WWDC 2025, Apple announced the introduction of a new live translation feature for its Messages, FaceTime, and Phone apps. This feature allows real-time language translation during conversations, enhancing seamless communication between users speaking different languages. Notably, the system operates entirely on-device using Apple Intelligence, a set of AI models built by Apple. By performing processing directly on the user’s device, the feature ensures greater privacy and faster responsiveness, eliminating the need to send data to external servers. This innovation is part of Apple’s broader push toward privacy-centric, AI-powered features across its ecosystem.

entries.title: Brightcove Unveils New AI Features
entries.snippet:
Brightcove has announced the release of seven new AI-powered features aimed at expanding global access, increasing engagement, enhancing live-streaming quality, and optimizing video workflows. These updates are part of a larger rollout of 12 tools introduced recently, and nearly 150 customers are already testing the new capabilities. A major highlight is the upgraded AI Suite, including a Universal Translator that supports video localization in over 50 languages and offers refined dubbing options such as synthetic and speaker-modeled voices. 

The Auto-Captions feature now offers greater accuracy and customization through the addition of a brand-sensitive dictionary. Another notable tool, Metadata Optimizer, enhances searchability and SEO by analyzing text, audio, and visuals, with support for over 40 languages. 

For mobile engagement, a new Vertical Videos gallery template enables swipeable video feeds on company websites. Also, the NextGen Live upgrade brings 4K UHD streaming, low-latency (as little as 8 seconds), and a unified system for live streaming, ad insertion, and content protection—enhancing quality, security, and monetization potential.
